selected_quotes: For your 🎧: The latest Anthill podcast looks at quantum computers, donating genomes, body farms and much more!
The latest episode of the Anthill is live! Science by the seaside looks at body farms, quantum computers and more
For your 🎧: Episode 17 of the Anthill podcast – Science by the seaside – is live!
I discover a 19th century attempt to promote women in science, in the latest episode of our podcast The Anthill

citation.abstract: From the man who gave away his genome under open consent, to the 'Mathematikado', this episode of the podcast features highlights from the British Science Festival in Brighton.
citation.title: Anthill 17: Science by the seaside

news.title: Anthill 17: Science by the seaside
news.summary: There aren’t many places you can find musical robots, an Arctic smellscape and an art gallery for babies.

facebook.title: Anthill 17: Science by the seaside
facebook.summary: The Anthill, a podcast of news outlet The Conversation (UK), ran an interview with Laura Kasson Fiss (Pavlis Honors College) and Andrew Fiss (HU), as well as recordings of songs they performed as part of their presentation at the British Science Festival.
